DataElement.preferredName: Household Survey Six Month Prior Child Diagnosis Worried Food Would Run Out Before Get Money to Buy More Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation about whether, in the 6 months prior to their child's diagnosis, they worried that their food would run out before they could get more money to buy more.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Household Survey Six Month Prior Child Diagnosis Worried Food Would Run Out Before Get Money to Buy More
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A social unit comprised of one or more individuals living together (all of whom need not be related) in the same dwelling, who aggregate and share their incomes._A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people._A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._Earlier in time or order._A person who is not yet an adult. The specific cut-off age will vary by purpose._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._A question about whether an individual is or was worried their food would run out before getting money to buy more.

It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:Earlier in time or order.:A person who is not yet an adult. The specific cut-off age will vary by purpose.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:A question about whether an individual is or was worried their food would run out before getting money to buy more.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
An age group comprised of individuals who are not yet an adult. The specific cut-off age will vary by purpose.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.longName: Worried Food Would Run Out Before Get Money to Buy More
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual is or was worried their food would run out before getting money to buy more.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: The first statement is, We worried whether our food would run out before we got money to buy more. Was that often, sometimes, or never true for your household in the last 6 months?
